channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole turning into Shelburne Rd, 19th August
item.description:
Pothole at top of the road, as you turn in from Lansdown Rd. exactly lined up with drivers side front wheel, hard to avoid. Deep enough to make a bang and stress the steering rack as you turn.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shelburne Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Potholes, damaged road surface., 19th August
item.description:
Potholes, and damaged road surface at the end of Mill Lane as it joins Southam Road. There are a number of them along the road junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Mill Lane, Southam, Tewkesbury

item.title: Hanging electric cable, 18th August
item.description:
There is a cable being lent on by a branch of a tree pushing this cable down which is now in danger of hitting on coming large vehicles. Branch needs cutting or releasing before a major incident
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Street, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Broken pavements, 16th August
item.description:
Openreach have dug the pavement and verge up to lay a new cable, they have left the pavement in a real mess, missing, broken, and uneven paving slabs. The verge is a real mess and the gutter is full of debris . The cost of repairs and reconstruction should be paid by openreach and their contractors.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Jersey Avenue, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins, 15th August
item.description:
In the St Pauls walk area various residents bins left out after collections, this is a regular occurrence and seems to fall on deaf ears. Is it not correct that all bins ect, should be off the road/pavement within 24 of collections.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, St Paul's Walk, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass Cutting, 15th August
item.description:
The grass verges in this area have not been cut for over 4 weeks, under guidelines issued (below) it is supposed to be done fortnightly. I have seen some residents have cut sections themselves. This is not right as we pay for this to be done. Also on the green is a tree stump that is 600mm high and quite dangerous considering children play here, and god forbid a child falling onto it. Maintenance of grass verges Grass verges are the responsibility of Gloucestershire County Council. In Cheltenham, the verges are maintained by Ubico (the borough council's contractor) under an agency agreement with the county council. The county council pay the borough council a contribution for five cuts per year. The borough council has agreed to fund an additional ten cuts per year which enables a cycle of fortnightly cuts. This means that the grass can be kept to the same standard as in our parks and open spaces. What residents can expect Grass verges are cut up to 15 times during the growing season usually between March and October, depending on weather conditions Cut grass should be removed from the pavement at the time the grass is cut Strimming takes place around benches, trees and other obstacles early in the growing season and then herbicide is applied around the base of trees and obstacles in April/May and again in September/October to prevent weed or grass growth Clippings will be left on the grass verge Where bulbs are planted, the grass will not be cut until the bulb foliage has died back and this is usually six to eight weeks after flowering Where wild flower planting has taken place, the grass will be left uncut for the duration of the season, normally until around late September to early October. All foliage will be removed from the site In periods of warm, wet weather grass may grow vigorously and following cutting the clippings are likely to clump and take longer to dissipate Where appropriate - and in consultation with residents - consideration will be given to promoting biodiversity with longer grass and wild flowers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, St Paul's Walk, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
